Morphemic: níitíi-n magaláa xéesáa meesháa náa-f gurgur-t-e.
Gloss: woman-NOM market inside.GEN things me-DAT sold-F-PFV
Translation: The woman inside the market sold goods for me.
Comment: Genitive marker (lengthening of the final vowel) on the postposition indicates that the adposition is a modifier for the head noun.

Morphemic: níitíi-n magaláa xéesá meesháa náa-f gurgur-t-e.
Gloss: woman-NOM market inside things me-DAT sold-F-PFV
Translation: The woman sold goods for me inside the market.
Comment: The adposition “in the market” is here adverbial.

Gloss: market inside.GEN woman-NOM things me-DAT sold-F-PFV

(The) man I called yesterday (has) died.
Comment: The insertion of kan [xan] (glossed as RL here) is optional.

Translation: (The) man who died yesterday arose/has arisen (from the dead).
